com.naef.jnlua.util
Class AbstractTableMap<K>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,java.lang.Object>
      com.naef.jnlua.util.AbstractTableMap<K>
All Implemented Interfaces:
LuaValueProxy, java.util.Map<K,java.lang.Object>
public abstract class AbstractTableMap<K>
extends java.util.AbstractMap<K,java.lang.Object>
implements LuaValueProxy

Abstract map implementation backed by a Lua table.

checkKey

protected void checkKey(java.lang.Object key)
Checks a key for validity. If the key is not valid, the method throws an appropriate runtime exception. The method is invoked for all input keys.

This implementation checks that the key is not null. Lua does not allow nil as a table key. Subclasses may implement more restrictive checks.

Parameters:
key - the key
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key is null

filterKeys

protected boolean filterKeys()
Indicates if this table map filters keys from the Lua table. If the method returns true, the table map invokes acceptKey(int) on each key retrieved from the underlying table to determine whether the key is accepted or rejected.

This implementation returns false. Subclasses may override the method alongside acceptKey(int) to implement key filtering.

Returns:
whether this table map filters keys from the Lua table

acceptKey

protected boolean acceptKey(int index)
Accepts or rejects a key from the Lua table. Only table keys that are accepted are processed. The method allows subclasses to filter the Lua table. The method is called only if filterKeys() returns true.

This implementation returns true regardless of the input, thus accepting all keys. Subclasses may override the method alongside filterKeys() to implement key filtering.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the candidate key
Returns:
whether the key is accepted

convertKey

protected abstract K convertKey(int index)
Converts the key at the specified stack index to a Java object. If this table maps performs key filtering, the method is invoked only for keys it has accepted.

Parameters:
index - the stack index containing the key
Returns:
the Java object representing the key
See Also:
filterKeys(), acceptKey(int)
